text:
So heartbreaking to see 45,000 flowers at the Washington Monument, each representing a life lost to gun violence annually. 

Today I joined @GabbyGiffords, @GiffordsCourage, @HouseDemocrats, & @SenateDems to take action to save lives. Enough is enough. #EndGunViolence https://t.co/lf5AAzFUzB

Every #NationalCancerSurvivorsDay, I am inspired to lead the fight in Congress to lower prescription drug prices, fund research, and provide the tools we need to beat cancer. Remember: the fight never stops — not until we find a cure. #NCSD2022 https://t.co/ruOkUh1T9y

Too many preventable deaths occur in pools and spas. In 2007, I introduced the Virginia Graeme Baker Pool & Spa Safety Act to prevent drownings. It works. So let's reauthorize this critical law to keep providing drowning prevention grants and raise pool safety awareness. #PassVGB https://t.co/1mA7d6LpWD

Today and every day, I am proud to stand with survivors of gun violence. I #WearOrange to keep those we lost close to my heart and remember that gun violence impacts all of us. We stand together to #EndGunViolence and recommit to keeping our communities safe. https://t.co/WLjdj5x39t

It's one of my greatest honors as a Congress Member to nominate some of our most qualified young people for appointments to our nation's Military Academies. 

Joseph, Jose Andres, Presley, Taylor, and Will, your dedication is an inspiration. I know you will make us proud! https://t.co/0vEmmyN7S1

Congrats to Admiral Linda Fagan on earning @USCG Commandant, and for blazing a trail as the 1st woman to lead a military service branch. Also, my best to Adm. Karl Schultz, on his retirement and a great Coast Guard career. https://t.co/Tbay6jLMBZ

This June, we have much to celebrate for #PrideMonth. @POTUS made huge strides to reverse the discriminatory policies of the last administration. Yet we must also push back against growing anti-LGBTQ+ rhetoric and legislation. We are better together! #LGBTQProud #SayGay https://t.co/Y3x1sjobtM

I’m proud to work with @POTUS to advance and expedite the Everglades Agricultural Area (EAA) Reservoir. 

Last year, Biden provided $350M in record restoration funding, plus $1.1B more in the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law, and he’ll seek record funding again in 2023. https://t.co/XV85pWR2s6
